perturbation.original_text: Licensor grants to Rogers the non-exclusive license and right to distribute and exhibit in Canada (the “Territory”) all entertainment programming to which Licensor owns or controls the VOD distribution and exhibition rights in the Territory (collectively, “Licensed Programs”) to residential subscribers of Rogers’ digital cable television service on a Video-on-Demand (“VOD”) basis. For clarity, the VOD service that Rogers provides to such subscribers shall hereinafter be referred to as the “ROD Service”.
perturbation.changed_text: The Content Provider grants to Rogers the non-exclusive license and right to distribute and exhibit in Canada (the “Territory”) all entertainment programming to which Licensor owns or controls the VOD distribution and exhibition rights in the Territory (collectively, “Licensed Programs”) to residential subscribers of Rogers’ digital cable television service on a Video-on-Demand (“VOD”) basis. For clarity, the VOD service that Rogers provides to such subscribers shall hereinafter be referred to as the “ROD Service”.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Licensor' to 'Content Provider' in the grant of rights section introduces confusion. The contract consistently uses 'Licensor' elsewhere to define obligations. This change creates uncertainty as to who is actually granting the rights.

perturbation.original_text: During the Term, Rogers shall have the non-exclusive right to distribute and exhibit each Licensed Program on a VOD basis for a period of ninety (90) consecutive days, or such longer period as may be agreed to by Rogers and Licensor (the “License Period”).
perturbation.changed_text: During the Term, Rogers shall have the non-exclusive right to distribute and exhibit each Licensed Program on a VOD basis for a period of ninety (90) consecutive days, or such shorter period as may be determined by Rogers and the Content Owner (the “License Period”).
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Licensor' to 'Content Owner' and 'longer period' to 'shorter period' creates contradiction. It is now unclear whether the License Period can be shorter than 90 days, potentially conflicting with other sections that assume a minimum 90-day period.

perturbation.original_text: In consideration for various services and activities that Rogers performs for the benefit of Licensor during the Term, Licensor agrees to pay to Rogers an amount which shall be equal to ten (10)% of License Fees, calculated on a rolling basis during the Term and payable monthly.
perturbation.changed_text: In consideration for various services and activities that Rogers performs for the benefit of the Program Provider during the Term, the Licensor agrees to pay to Rogers an amount which shall be equal to five (5)% of License Fees, calculated on a rolling basis during the Term and payable quarterly.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Licensor' to 'Program Provider', and changing percentage of payment from 10% to 5%, and changing payment period from 'monthly' to 'quarterly' creates contradiction. It is now unclear what the agreed upon amount due should be, as well as the payment schedule. There is confusion as to who is responsible for the payment
